personalInfo.family: Wife, Alayna; Jraice (11/28/11), Leilene Aiaga (10/21/12), Tony (3/28/15)
personalInfo.splInterest: Fire knife dancing, playing guitar, watching movies

tourBios.curYearHigh: In his first start at the Puerto Rico Open at Coco Beach, overcame a one-stroke deficit in the final round with a 2-under 70 to force sudden death with Steve Marino. The duo matched birdies on the par-5 18th hole twice in overtime, before a third-consecutive birdie at 18 from Finau proved too much for Marino. Finau's win snapped a stretch of disappointing performances leading up to Puerto Rico, defined by four missed cuts in his previous five starts.
tourBios.carHigh:
Has also competed on Gateway Tour, NGA Tour and National Pro Tour. 

2013: Made seven cuts in eight starts on PGA TOUR Canada, finishing 29th on the Order of Merit...Shot a final-round 64 to finish a season-best T5 at the ATB Financial Classic presented by TELUS... Shot four rounds in the 60s to finish T7 at The Great Waterway Classic...Recorded a double eagle during the opening round of the Web.com Tour's BMW Charity Pro-Am, his only Tour start. Used a 5-iron from 216 yards at the par-5 fifth hole at the Thornblade Club, where he posted an even-par 71. Wound up finishing 65th for the second consecutive year...Six rounds in the 60s led to a 25-under performance and T3 finish at Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in December.

2012: In his only Web.com Tour start, finished 65th at the BMW Charity Pro Am.

2011: Missed the cut at the Sony Open in Hawaii...Finished T45 at the Utah Championship in his home state. Shot a second round 65 at Willow Creek CC to go with three 71s.

2010: Missed the cut at the Web.com Tour's Utah Championship.

2008: Shot a second-round 67 but still missed the cut at the PGA TOUR's U.S. Bank Championship in Milwaukee...Made one European Tour appearance, missing the cut at the SAS Masters.

2007: Fired a pair of 74s at the Utah EnergySolutions Championship on the Web.com Tour to miss the cut...Missed the cut in his first two European Tour starts, at the KLM Open and the Scandinavian Masters.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was two-time medalist in the Utah state high school championship and a member of the 2006 state championship team. Was a first-team all-state selection four times...Won the 2006 Utah State Amateur, beating Daniel Summerhays...Was 2007 Athlete of the Year at West High School...Turned professional out of high school at age 17 in 2007...Won the Provo Open in 2012 and 2013...Finished second on Golf Channel's "Big Break Disney."...Won the Junior World Golf Championship in 2002.
tourBios.personal: Has four brothers and two sisters...Attended West High School in Salt Lake City...Played center on the basketball team and helped team reach the state tournament his junior and senior seasons. Averaged 11 rebounds per game as a senior. Chose to not pursue basketball and concentrated on golf instead...Sister, Kaylene, played on the College of Southern Idaho National Junior College Athletic Association volleyball championship team in 2006...Brother, Gipper, is the youngest player to make a Web.com Tour cut, doing so at 16 years, 20 days in Utah in 2006 (T58)...His cousin is the Milwaukee Bucks' Jabari Parker...If not a professional golfer, he would be a chef...Favorite golf course is The Olympic Club...Favorite teams are the Los Angeles Lakers, the Dallas Cowboys, the Utah Utes and the USC Trojans...Favorite movie is "Gladiator."...Likes sushi and brownies...Favorite athlete is Kobe Bryant...Favorite vacation spot is the North Shore of Hawaii...Favorite shows are "The Voice" and "Sing Off."...Would like to trade places with his son for a day "to see how he views me."...Dream foursome would be Lee Trevino, Steve Stricker and "my brother."...You may not know that he had a stomach ulcer in 2012...Would like to own a Rolls Royce one day...Supports the Kruger Foundation...First-tee introduction song would be "Natural Mystic" by Bob Marley.

tourBios.curYrHigh: In his first start at the Puerto Rico Open at Coco Beach, overcame a one-stroke deficit in the final round with a 2-under 70 to force sudden death with Steve Marino. The duo matched birdies on the par-5 18th hole twice in overtime, before a third-consecutive birdie at 18 from Finau proved too much for Marino. Finau's win snapped a stretch of disappointing performances leading up to Puerto Rico, defined by four missed cuts in his previous five starts.
tourBios.personal: Turned professional out of high school at age 17

tourBios.curYearHigh: In his first start at the Puerto Rico Open at Coco Beach, overcame a one-stroke deficit in the final round with a 2-under 70 to force sudden death with Steve Marino. The duo matched birdies on the par-5 18th hole twice in overtime, before a third-consecutive birdie at 18 from Finau proved too much for Marino. Finau's win snapped a stretch of disappointing performances leading up to Puerto Rico, defined by four missed cuts in his previous five starts.
tourBios.carHigh:
Has also competed on Gateway Tour, NGA Tour and National Pro Tour. 

2014-15: PGA TOUR rookie enjoyed a solid year, amassing five top-10 finishes in 28 starts through the Wyndham Championship. As a result, became one of nine rookies to advance to the FedExCup Playoffs. Was one of just four to make it to the BMW Championship, the third of four events in the Playoffs. Finished T47 at the BMW Championship at Conway Farms GC to end his season at No. 43 in the FedExCup standings...One week after finishing T12 in his rookie debut, at the Frys.com Open, recorded his first top-10, a T7 at the Shriners Hospitals for Children Open, in his fifth overall PGA TOUR start. With rounds of 68-65-70-67, finished six strokes behind champion Ben Martin...Was one off the lead after 36 holes at the AT&T Byron Nelson, finishing T10 after weekend rounds of 68-68...Recorded the best finish by a rookie in the Memorial Tournament field, carding rounds of 71-66-73-67 to finish T8...In just his second major championship start, claimed a T10 with Robert Streb at the PGA Championship (11-under 277). Posted four, sub-par scores at Whistling Straits in Wisconsin, highlighted by a 6-under 66 in the second round. In his first major start earlier in the season, finished T14 at the U.S. Open.

2013-14: Finished the Web.com Tour season with 23 starts, which resulted in a win, two T4s, a fifth-place finish, 14 top-25s and only four missed cuts...First Tour top-10 came in May in Raleigh, N.C. Was four strokes back after 54 holes at the Rex Hospital Open. Fired a final-round 67 for a T4...In late June, opened the United Leasing Championship with a 71. Made back-to-back eagles, including the 500th hole-in-one in Web.com Tour history (11th hole), in the second round en route to a 64. Held the 36-hole lead but fell to T5 after 72-74 on the weekend...Two weeks later, made his 11th consecutive cut and contended all week as the hometown favorite at the Utah Championship. Enjoyed four rounds in the 60s at Willow Creek CC in the Salt Lake City suburb of Sandy to finish solo fifth, playing about 15 miles from his boyhood home...Collected his first career title with a convincing three-stroke win at the Stonebrae Classic in early August. Held a one-shot lead after 54 holes, thanks to middle rounds of 62-63. Kept his challengers at bay during the fog-delayed final round at TPC Stonebrae. A birdie at No. 15 increased his lead to two. He closed with three consecutive pars to pick up the title. Winner's check of $108,000 vaulted him from No. 24 to No. 8 on the money list with only three weeks left in the Regular Season. Winning score of 258 matched the second-lowest 72-hole score in Tour history. Finished with a tournament-record 22-under total, three better than Fabian Gomez, Zack Sucher and fellow rookie Daniel Berger. Became the 13th first-time winner in the Tour's first 18 events of the season...Recorded a T11 the next week in Springfield, Mo....Then officially secured his 2014-15 PGA TOUR card for the first time at the conclusion of the Regular Season in late August at the WinCo Foods Portland Open as No. 8 on the money list...After T19 and T46 finishes to open the Web.com Tour Finals in Fort Wayne, Ind. and Charlotte, N.C., respectively, was in contention the following week at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship. Opened with a first-round 66 and followed with 72-72-71 to finish T6 at Ohio State University GC's Scarlet Course...Completed his season with a T14 at the Web.com Tour Championship, closing with a 66.

2013: Made seven cuts in eight starts on PGA TOUR Canada, finishing 29th on the Order of Merit...Shot a final-round 64 to finish a season-best T5 at the ATB Financial Classic presented by TELUS... Shot four rounds in the 60s to finish T7 at The Great Waterway Classic...Recorded a double eagle during the opening round of the Web.com Tour's BMW Charity Pro-Am, his only Tour start. Used a 5-iron from 216 yards at the par-5 fifth hole at the Thornblade Club, where he posted an even-par 71. Wound up finishing 65th for the second consecutive year...Six rounds in the 60s led to a 25-under performance and T3 finish at Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in December.

2012: In his only Web.com Tour start, finished 65th at the BMW Charity Pro Am.

2011: Missed the cut at the Sony Open in Hawaii...Finished T45 at the Utah Championship in his home state. Shot a second round 65 at Willow Creek CC to go with three 71s.

2010: Missed the cut at the Web.com Tour's Utah Championship.

2008: Shot a second-round 67 but still missed the cut at the PGA TOUR's U.S. Bank Championship in Milwaukee...Made one European Tour appearance, missing the cut at the SAS Masters.

2007: Fired a pair of 74s at the Utah EnergySolutions Championship on the Web.com Tour to miss the cut...Missed the cut in his first two European Tour starts, at the KLM Open and the Scandinavian Masters.

Amateur: Was two-time medalist in the Utah state high school championship and a member of the 2006 state championship team. Was a first-team all-state selection four times...Won the 2006 Utah State Amateur, beating Daniel Summerhays...Was 2007 Athlete of the Year at West High School...Turned professional out of high school at age 17 in 2007...Won the Provo Open in 2012 and 2013...Finished second on Golf Channel's "Big Break Disney."...Won the Junior World Golf Championship in 2002.
tourBios.personal: Has four brothers and two sisters...Played center on the basketball team and helped team reach the state tournament his junior and senior seasons. Averaged 11 rebounds per game as a senior. Chose to not pursue basketball and concentrated on golf instead...Sister, Kaylene, played on the College of Southern Idaho National Junior College Athletic Association volleyball championship team in 2006...Brother, Gipper, is the youngest player to make a Web.com Tour cut, doing so at age 16 years, 20 days in Utah in 2006 (T58)...His cousin is the Milwaukee Bucks' Jabari Parker...Attended West High, the same high school as 1926 U.S. Amateur champion and five-time PGA TOUR winner George Von Elm...If not a professional golfer, he would be a chef...Favorite golf course is The Olympic Club...Favorite teams are the Los Angeles Lakers, the Dallas Cowboys, the Utah Utes and the USC Trojans...Favorite movie is "Gladiator."...Likes sushi and brownies...Favorite athlete is Kobe Bryant...Favorite vacation spot is the North Shore of Hawaii...Favorite TV shows are "The Voice" and "Sing Off."...Would like to trade places with his son for a day "to see how he views me."...Dream foursome would be Lee Trevino, Steve Stricker and "my brother."...Says many people don't know he had a stomach ulcer in 2012...Would like to own a Rolls Royce one day...Established his own foundation (tonyfinaufoundation.org)...First-tee introduction song would be "Natural Mystic" by Bob Marley.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR in 2016 is 1st at the Puerto Rico Open at Coco Beach.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks 63rd in Scoring Average (Actual) on the PGA TOUR.
